title: What can I do to possibly get a lien off of my home?
answers: Since this is a voluntary lien, you cannot get rid of it in a Chapter 7. Depending on the value of your house, you can probably strip at least a portion if you do a Chapter 13 repayment plan.

Bankruptcy has no provisions to avoid a voluntary lien. To get that money, you would have voluntarily agreed to place the lien on the property. 11 USC 522(f)(1) allows for the avoidance of a judgment lien only.

Chapter 13 might allow you to "strip" the lien, but only if your property is worth less than the balance of senior liens.

I have no opinion on whether state law might help you with this, so you should talk to a real estate attorney about it.
